pvardefs.name: pErroneousTokens
pvardefs.desc: optional field - only applicable if pCharTokens is false

pvardefs.name: pTransposeCol
pvardefs.desc: Lines to be turned to cols

pvardefs.name: pListColsType
pvardefs.desc: comma separated column types  e.g. con(k2dp,',',kDate2000)

name: $SubString
desc: Returns a substring of pString Starting on the pos of pStartString and ending on the pos of pEndStringIf pInclude is true, the returned string will include the text in pStartString and pEndString

pvardefs.name: pCompleteWords
pvardefs.desc: express in complete words?  e.g. 12h 4m 3s (kFalse) or 12hours 4minutes 3seconds (kTrue)

pvardefs.name: pLargerUnitsOver
pvardefs.desc: express pUnits in larger units when units exceed this figure (e.g. 120 days) (e.g. 360 days as 11m 3w 1d)

pvardefs.name: pLargerUnitsCutoff
pvardefs.desc: when expressing larger units, how many units to express e.g. 2y 3m 1w 4d can be cutoff to two units and expressed 2y 3m (truncated, not rounded)

pvardefs.name: pCompleteWords
pvardefs.desc: express in complete words?  e.g. 2y 4m 3d (kFalse) or 2years 4months 3days (kTrue)

pvardefs.name: pLargerUnitsOver
pvardefs.desc: express pUnits in larger units when units exceed this figure (e.g. 120 days) (e.g. 360 days as 11m 3w 1d)

pvardefs.name: pLargerUnitsCutoff
pvardefs.desc: when expressing larger units, how many units to express e.g. 2y 3m 1w 4d can be cutoff to two units and expressed 2y 3m (truncated, not rounded)

pvardefs.name: pnLength
pvardefs.desc: length of random character string to set

pvardefs.name: pcDrawFrom
pvardefs.desc: can contain A for uppercase, a for lowercase, 0 (zero) for digits and * for symbols

pvardefs.name: pcFirstChar
pvardefs.desc: if set determines first character must be of this type (e.g. A for upper case char)

pvardefs.name: pcOmitBadChars
pvardefs.desc: eliminate capital O, capital I, lower case L from strings so not to confuse with numerics

pvardefs.name: pcFormat
pvardefs.desc: n- will put a dash after every 4th char

name: $coalesce
desc: accepts a list of references to variables/list or row columns and returns the first not null value
